case_name: Roop Singh & Ors. v. State of Punjab

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from the Judgment and Order dated February 26, 1971, of the Punjab and Haryana High Court at Chandigarh in Criminal Appeal No. 96 of 1968.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the Judgment and Order dated February 26, 1971, of the Punjab and Haryana High Court at Chandigarh in Criminal Appeal No. 96 of 1968.

facts.text: The Six appellants were tried along with Major Singh 14, Inder Singh 50 and Teja Singh 42 in the court of the Additional Sessions-Judge Barnala.

anchor.surface_text: The Six appellants were tried along ,with Major Singh  14 , Inder Singh  50  and Teja Singh  42  in the companyrt of the Additional Sessions-Judge Barnala on various charges

facts.text: Learned Additional Sessions Judge acquitted all the nine accused.

anchor.surface_text: Learned Additional Sessions Judge acquitted all the nine accused. On appeal by the State of Punjab, the High Court companyvicted the six accused appellants

facts.text: On appeal by the State of Punjab, the High Court convicted the six accused appellants under section 302 read with section 149 and section 326 read with section 149 Indian Penal Code.

anchor.surface_text: On appeal by the State of Punjab, the High Court companyvicted the six accused appellants under section 302 read with section 149 and section 326 read with section 149 Indian Penal Code and sentenced each

facts.text: The maize crop from the land was thrashed on November 7, 1966 at the mill of one Dalip Singh.

anchor.surface_text: The maize crop from the land was thrashed on November 7, 1966 at the mill of one Dalip Singh at a short distance from the abadi of village, Kangar to which

facts.text: At about 5.30 p.m. on that day Amar Singh deceased and his son PW Gurmail Singh 16 as well as Mastan Singh deceased, his son Mohinder Singh deceased and nephew PW Bachan Singh 45 were present at the mills.

anchor.surface_text: At about 5.30 p.m. on that day Amar Singh deceased and his son PW Gurmail Singh  16  as well as Mastan Singh deceased, his son Mohinder Singh deceased and nephew PW

facts.text: The nine accused came there from the direction of the village abadi. Roop Singh, Inder Singh and Major Singh were armed with barchhas, while Teja Singh had a gun. The remaining accused carried gandasas.

anchor.surface_text: While these persons were busy in weighing and trying the maize in bundles, the nine accused came there from the direction of the village abadi. Roop Singh, Inder Singh

facts.text: Naib Singh then gave a gandasa blow on the head of Bachan Singh.

anchor.surface_text: Naib Singh then gave a gandasa blow on the head of Bachan Singh. The wrong side of the galidasa struck the head of Bachan Singh, whereafter another gandasa blow

facts.text: Mastan Singh deceased then ran towards a well... Teja Singh... came in front... Roop Singh gave a barchha blow in the neck... Naib Singh, Maghar Singh and Tara Singh then gave gandasa blows to Mastan Singh.

anchor.surface_text: Mastan Singh deseased then ran towards a well. Mastan Singh-had hardly companyered a distance of 8 or 9 karams when Teja Singh, who was holding a gun, came in front of Mastan Singh

facts.text: Mohinder Singh deceased tried to run towards Village Dina but he was surrounded... by Nirbhai Singh, Paranjan Singh, Inder Singh and Major Singh... given a gandasa blow on his head by Nirbhai Singh.

anchor.surface_text: Mohinder Singh deceased tried to run towards Village Dina but he was surrounded at a distance of about 18 karams by Nirbhai Singh, Paranjan Singh, Inder Singh and Major Singh.

facts.text: Tara Singh, Roop Singh, Naib Singh and Maghar Singh ran after Amar Singh... gave gandasa blows... barchha blow... gandasa blow on the neck.

anchor.surface_text: After giving blows to Mastan Singh, Tara Singh, Roop Singh, Naib Singh and Maghar Singh ran after Amar Singh and surrounded him near the house of one Tara Singh refugee.

facts.text: The occurrence was witnessed by Bahadur Singh PW 3, Bachan Singh PW 9, Gurmail Singh PW 12 and Atma Singh Sarpanch PW 15.

anchor.surface_text: The occurrence, it is stated, was witnessed by Bahadur Singh  PW 3 , Bachan Singh  PW 9 , Gurmail Singh  PW 12  and Atma Singh Sarpanch  PW 15  All the nine accused

facts.text: Accompanied by Gajjan Singh, Bachan Singh went... to police station Dialpura... and lodged there report P.J. at 7 p.m.

anchor.surface_text: Accompanied by Gajjan Singh, Bachan Singh, according to the prosecution, went through a circuitous route to police station Dialpura, at a distance of two miles from the place

facts.text: Bachan Singh was thereafter sent to hospital at Bhagta, where his injuries were examined by Dr. Surjit Singh at 10-40p.m.

anchor.surface_text: Bachan Singh was thereafter sent to hospital at Bhagta, where his injuries were examined by Dr. Surjit Singh at 10-40p.m. Bhagta is at a distance of 7 or 8 miles

facts.text: Sub Inspector Jagjit Singh... arrived at the place of occurrence at about 8.15 p.m.

anchor.surface_text: After report about the present occurrence had been lodged at the police, station, Sub Inspector Jagjit Singh left the police station and arrived at the place of occurrence at about 8.15 p.m.

facts.text: Post mortem examination on the dead bodies was performed by Dr. Tejinder Singh... on November 9, 1966.

anchor.surface_text: Post mortem examination on the, dead bodies was performed by Dr. Tejinder Singh at Mandi Phul at distance of 14 miles from the place of occurrence on November 9, 1966.

facts.text: There was a long standing enmity between the party of the accused and that of the three deceased persons. In 1964 Kaka Singh, brother of Roop Singh accused, and Nagender Singh... were murdered.

anchor.surface_text: The case for the prosecution is that there was a long standing enmity between the party of the accused and that of the three deceased persons. In 1964 Kaka Singh, brother

facts.text: The accused denied the prosecution allegations about their having participated in the present occurrence.

anchor.surface_text: The accused, in their statements under section 342 Code of Criminal Procedure, denied the prosecution allegations about their having participated in the present occurrence.

facts.text: The High Court found that the testimony of Bachan Singh and Gurmail Singh was natural and probable.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court in appeal, on companysideration of the evidence, found that the testimony of Bachan Singh and Gurmail Singh was natural and probable.

facts.text: Dr. Tejinder Singh... found nine incised wounds and 14 abrasions on the body of Mohinder Singh deceased... Two... sufficient to cause death.

anchor.surface_text: Dr. Tejinder Singh, who performed post mortem examination on the three dead bodies, found nine incised wounds and 14 abrasions on the body of Mohinder Singh deceased.

facts.text: The nature of the injuries... leaves no doubt that the assailants intended to cause their death.

anchor.surface_text: The nature of the injuries which were found on the bodies of the, three deceased persons leaves numberdoubt that the assailants intended to cause their death.

facts.text: Sub Inspector found two quintals and 35 kg of maize lying at the place of occurrence.

anchor.surface_text: The evidence of Sub Inspector Jagjit Singh shows that he found two quintals and 35 kg of maize lying at the place of occurrence when he arrived there.

facts.text: Bachan Singh had three injuries: incised wound on left wrist, lacerated wound on head, bruise on deltoid.

anchor.surface_text: Bachan Singh was found to have the following three injuries  1.  Incised wound  margin clean cut  2-1/2 x 1/2 x 1 on the dorsum of left wrist joint cutting the tendons

facts.text: Bachan Singh had to stay as an indoor patient in the hospital for 21 or 22 days.

anchor.surface_text: It is also in evidence that Bachan Singh had to stay as an indoor patient in the hospital for 21 or 22 days because of the injuries received by him

facts.text: The Supreme Court finds good reasons for the High Court to accept the evidence of Bachan Singh and Gurmail Singh.
